      • register

        public java.util.Set<CommandInfo> register(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                  java.lang.Object obj)
                                    throws CommandException
        Registers all of the methods in the given Class that are tagged with the Command annotation.
        Specified by:
        register in interface CommandManager
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class that holds of the tagged methods.
        obj - An Object of the given Class. Can be null if all of the methods are static.
        Returns:
        An Set of CommandInfos that are registered.
        Throws:
        CommandException
        See Also:
        CommandManager.register(java.lang.Class, java.lang.Object)

      • register

        public java.util.Set<CommandInfo> register(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
                                    throws CommandException
        Registers all of the methods in the given Class that are tagged with the Command annotation. Will call CommandManager.register(Class, Object) with obj = null.

        NOTE: Only call this if all of the tagged methods are static.

        Specified by:
        register in interface CommandManager
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class that holds of the tagged methods.
        Returns:
        An Set of CommandInfos that are registered.
        Throws:
        CommandException
        See Also:
        CommandManager.register(java.lang.Class)

      • register

        public java.util.Set<CommandInfo> register(java.lang.Object obj)
                                    throws CommandException
        Registers all of the methods in the given Class that are tagged with the Command annotation. Will call CommandManager.register(Class, Object) with clazz = Object.getClass().
        Specified by:
        register in interface CommandManager
        Parameters:
        obj - An Object of the given Class. Will be used to get the Class of the Object.
        Returns:
        An Set of CommandInfos that are registered.
        Throws:
        CommandException
        See Also:
        CommandManager.register(java.lang.Object)
